name: 1dfft
author: AFNI Team
description: Compute the absolute value of the FFT of input columns from an AFNI 1D file.

inputs.description: Input .1D file containing an ASCII list of numbers arranged in columns.
inputs.name: Input file

inputs.description: Output file to store the FFT results.
inputs.name: Output file

inputs.description: Skip the first 'sss' lines in the input file. [default = no skipping]
inputs.name: Ignore lines

inputs.description: Use only 'uuu' lines of the input file. [default = use them all]
inputs.name: Use lines

inputs.description: Set FFT length to 'nnn'. [default = length of data (# of lines used)]
inputs.name: FFT length

inputs.description: Save Re and Im parts of transform in 2 columns.
inputs.name: Save Re and Im parts flag

inputs.description: Convert 2 column complex input into 1 column real output. Note: This will not work if the original data FFT length was an odd number.
inputs.name: Convert complex to real flag

inputs.description: When -fromcx is used, the inverse FFT will do the Hilbert transform instead.
inputs.name: Hilbert transform flag

inputs.description: Skip the detrending of the input.
inputs.name: No detrend flag

output-files.description: Output file with the absolute value of the FFT of the input columns.
output-files.name: Output FFT file
